metadata.title: CVE-2019-6109 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in OpenSSH 7.9. Due to missing character encodingin the progress display, a malicious server (or Man-in-The-Middle attacker)can employ crafted object names to manipulate the client output, e.g., byusing ANSI control codes to hide additional files being transferred. Thisaffects refresh_progress_meter() in progressmeter.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-6109` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.7
openssh-client-ssh1 - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.7
openssh-server - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.7
openssh-sftp-server - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.7
ssh - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.7
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.7
ssh-krb5 - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.7').
